title: LIVE: Nigeria vs DR Congo – CAF World Cup qualifiers playoff final
summary: Follow the build-up, analysis, and live text commentary of the CAF playoffs final for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

title: India arrests Kashmir resident over deadly Delhi car blast
summary: Authorities say the arrested man is the owner of the car that exploded near the Red Fort.

title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine working on new prisoner exchange with Russia
summary: Exchanges have been the only progress of any note in negotiations between the two countries in the nearly four-year war.

title: 50,000 fans cheer for Palestine at friendly football match in Spain
summary: The Palestinian national football team played their first match in Europe in a generation against Basque Country.

title: Iran says no prospect of talks as West builds pressure over nuclear issue
summary: Foreign minister says Iran has not been enriching uranium at any of its sites since Israel and the US bombed them.

title: No medical training could prepare me for a ‘life-genocide balance’
summary: I volunteered in Gaza as a doctor. The anger, guilt, and helplessness I continue to feel are unbearable.

title: UN peacekeepers say Israeli forces fire on them in southern Lebanon
summary: Latest Israeli attack on UNIFIL comes as it continues near-daily strikes on its northern neighbour in truce violation.

title: What’s Grokipedia, Musk’s AI-powered rival to Wikipedia?
summary: Grokipedia copies Wikipedia’s format, but loose fact-checking and weak citations leave many of its claims unreliable.

title: Chile votes for new president in communist vs far-right contest
summary: Elections pit governing leftist coalition against conservative challenger and will also redefine country's legislature.

title: Video: Gen Z protests in Mexico fuelled by mayor’s murder
summary: Gen Z protesters in Mexico are demanding an end to impunity for gang violence and calling for justice.

title: What will be the fallout from Ukraine’s worsening corruption scandal?
summary: Several ministers have resigned in the wake of a $100m corruption investigation.

title: Why are biologic drugs expensive? Will Trump’s plans make them cheaper?
summary: FDA aims to speed biosimilar approvals to increase competition, but experts warn drug prices may not drop quickly.

title: Liban : les Casques bleus accusent l'armée israélienne de leur avoir tiré dessus à partir d'un char
summary: La Force intérimaire des Nations unies au Liban (Finul) a accusé l'armée israélienne, dimanche, d'avoir tiré sur des soldats de la paix "à partir d'un char Merkava situé près d'une position établie par Israël en territoire libanais". La force onusienne a exhorté Israël "à cesser tout comportement agressif et toute attaque" contre ou à proximité de ses Casques bleus.

title: Laetitia Bucaille : En Cisjordanie, "l’objectif est de faire se déplacer les Palestiniens"
summary: En Cisjordanie, les violences des colons israéliens s’intensifient. Hier encore, deux adolescents palestiniens ont été tués près d’Hébron, une mosquée a également été incendiée et des raids menés par des groupes de colons ont blessé plusieurs Palestiniens et détruit de nombreux biens. Ces attaques, de plus en plus fréquentes, se déroulent dans une quasi-impunité. Une situation analysée avec la sociologue Laetitia Bucaille.

title: La Finul accuse Israël de construire des murs au Liban, Tsahal dément
summary: La Force intérimaire des Nations Unies au Liban (Finul) a accusé Israël, vendredi, d'avoir "violé" la souveraineté du Liban avec la construction de murs sur son territoire. L'armée israélienne a démenti, reconnaissant toutefois avoir érigé une barrière renforcée le long de la ligne de démarcation entre les deux pays.

title: Gaza : la dépouille de l'otage Meni Godard a été rendue à Israël par le Hamas
summary: Le Hamas et le Jihad islamique ont rendu jeudi à Gaza la dépouille de l'otage israélien Meni Godard, tué le 7 octobre 2023 à l'âge de 73 ans. De son côté, l'Autorité palestinienne a annoncé que des soldats israéliens avaient tué dans le sud de la Cisjordanie deux adolescents de 15 ans, présentés par l'armée israélienne comme des "terroristes en passe de perpétrer une attaque".

title: Trump a écrit au président israélien pour demander une grâce pour Netanyahu
summary: Dans un courrier adressé au président israélien, Donald Trump a demandé qu'une grâce soit accordée au Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu, poursuivi dans son pays pour corruption, a révélé mercredi le bureau de la présidence.

title: Législatives en Irak : le Premier ministre sortant Mohamed Chia al-Soudani revendique la victoire
summary: Après les premiers résultats de la commission électorale donnant sa liste en tête aux législatives, le Premier ministre sortant Mohamed Chia al-Soudani a revendiqué la victoire mardi soir. La formation du prochain gouvernement irakien devrait toutefois donner lieu à d'intenses tractations.

title: Israël rouvre un point de passage "permanent" aux camions d'aide dans le nord de Gaza
summary: Les autorités israéliennes ont annoncé mercredi la réouverture "permanente" du point de passage de Zikim, au nord de la bande de Gaza, pour permettre l'entrée d'aide humanitaire internationale dans le territoire palestinien, ravagé par plus de deux ans de guerre.

title: Mahmoud Abbas à Paris : bientôt des élections ?
summary: Pour sa première visite en France en tant que chef d'État, depuis la reconnaissance de la Palestine par Paris, Mahmoud Abbas s'engage auprès d'Emmanuel Macron sur la tenue d'élections sur l'ensemble des territoires palestiniens. Les dernières datent de près de vingt ans. On va plus loin avec Patricia Allémonière et Melina Huet.

title: Gaza : les combattants du Hamas piégés dans des tunnels à Rafah, un test décisif pour le plan Trump
summary: Le sort de près de 200 combattants du Hamas, retranchés dans des tunnels à Rafah, dans une zone contrôlée par l’armée israélienne, menace de faire voler en éclats le cessez-le-feu à Gaza. Alors que le mouvement islamiste palestinien rejette toute idée de reddition, Washington craint que leur élimination sur ordre d’un Benjamin Netanyahu sous pression empêche toute avancée du plan Trump.

title: Que reste-t-il du Hezbollah ?
summary: Le chef du Hezbollah, Naïm Qassem, a de nouveau affirmé que la milice chiite n’abandonnera pas les armes au Liban. Pour autant, il dit respecter le cessez-le-feu et ne pas avoir tiré sur Israël depuis. Dans les faits, que reste-t-il réellement de l'arsenal du Hezbollah et de son influence ?

title: Israël dit avoir arrêté des colons impliqués dans des violences en Cisjordanie occupée
summary: En Israël, l'armée et la police ont affirmé mardi avoir appréhendé plusieurs civils israéliens ayant attaqué, masqués, des Palestiniens et incendié des biens dans la région de Tulkarem, en Cisjordanie occupée.

title: Rencontre Macron-Abbas : le président palestinien s'engage à organiser des élections
summary: Le président palestinien Mahmoud Abbas s'est engagé mardi à mener des réformes, dont la tenue d'élections, lors de sa rencontre avec Emmanuel Macron à l'Élysée. Le chef de l'État a quant à lui assuré que les projets d'annexion israéliens constituaient une "ligne rouge".

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : le gouvernement israélien va former une commission d’enquête sur le 7-Octobre, selon la presse
summary: En dépit de sondages montrant qu’une large majorité d’Israéliens, quelles que soient leurs orientations politiques, est favorable à la création d’une telle commission, le gouvernement de Benyamin Nétanyahou s’y était jusqu’ici opposé.

title: Trois morts après le passage de la tempête Claudia au Portugal et au Royaume-Uni
summary: Une femme britannique ainsi qu’un couple d’octogénaires sont décédés au Portugal, dont plusieurs districts ont été placés en alerte orange.

title: « Les entreprises parlent d’IA mais l’adoptent bien moins rapidement que leurs employés »
summary: Les usages de l’intelligence artificielle se déploient avant tout au sein du grand public, dans la vie quotidienne, quand les organisations peinent à l’intégrer, explique le consultant Georges Nahon dans une tribune au « Monde ».

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : la Russie revendique la prise de deux nouveaux villages dans la région de Zaporijia
summary: Les forces russes, mieux équipées et plus nombreuses, continuent de grignoter du terrain dans le sud de l’Ukraine. Mais le front le plus actif reste celui de l’Est, notamment autour de Pokrovsk.

title: L’Iran lance une opération d’ensemencement des nuages face à une sécheresse inédite
summary: « Un vol d’ensemencement des nuages a été effectué dans le bassin du lac d’Ourmia », dans le nord-ouest du pays, a fait savoir samedi soir l’agence officielle IRNA, qui précise que d’autres sont prévus dans les provinces de l’Azerbaïdjan oriental et occidental.

title: « A l’ombre de la race. Chine, XIXᵉ siècle », de Clément Fabre : comprendre l’incompréhension des Occidentaux en Chine
summary: Avec ce brillant essai, le jeune chercheur renouvelle l’histoire de la façon dont les Européens ont appréhendé les Chinois dès lors qu’ils ont pu entrer dans l’empire du Milieu, au XIXᵉ siècle.

title: Le Français Camilo Castro, libéré par le Venezuela, a atterri à Paris dimanche
summary: Sa libération avait été annoncée dans la matinée par le président de la République, Emmanuel Macron. Ce professeur de yoga de 41 ans avait disparu le 26 juin au poste-frontière de Paraguachon, séparant le Venezuela de la Colombie, où il réside.

title: Attentats du 13-Novembre : « Dix ans plus tard, la propagande de l’Etat islamique s’est affaiblie, mais elle ne s’est pas tue »
summary: Dans une tribune au « Monde », Laurence Bindner, spécialiste de la communication des groupes extrémistes violents, évoque les nouvelles stratégies de l’organisation Etat islamique en matière de propagande numérique, qui a su s’adapter aux mutations des réseaux sociaux.

title: Sur la question israélo-palestinienne, les positions tchèque et slovène, reflet des dissensions européennes
summary: L’histoire de la République tchèque et de la Slovénie n’explique qu’en partie les postures aujourd’hui très contrastées de ces deux pays face à Israël, explique l’historien Jean-Pierre Filiu dans sa chronique.

title: Déployer les armées européennes en quelques jours : le défi de l’OTAN face à la Russie
summary: Longtemps négligée, la logistique revient au cœur des priorités occidentales face à la menace russe. Entre investissements tardifs, lourdeurs administratives et dépendance vis-à-vis des Etats-Unis, les Européens s’efforcent de bâtir des infrastructures capables de soutenir un déploiement rapide de troupes de l’Alliance atlantique vers le flanc est.

title: Après l’exil, l’appel de la terre d’une famille syrienne
summary: Installés au Liban depuis dix ans, Fodda et Walid El-Youssef sont revenus, en octobre, avec leurs cinq enfants, dans le hameau qu’ils avaient dû abandonner durant la guerre civile. Cultivateurs versés dans l’agroécologie, ils entendent contribuer à rebâtir une agriculture et semer les graines de la Syrie de demain.

title: Au Chili, l’immigration vénézuélienne au cœur de la campagne présidentielle
summary: Les Chiliens votent, dimanche, pour choisir le successeur du président de gauche Gabriel Boric ainsi que leurs députés. L’alternance à la présidence est probable, peut-être au profit de l’extrême droite.

title: Gaza displacement camps hit by floods amid winter storm
summary:
Gaza displacement camps hit by floods amid winter storm

Palestinian Civil Defence crews say they rushed to flooded encampments south of Khan Younis as heavy rain swept through Gaza’s makeshift settlements, overwhelming tents that offer little protection after months of bombardment.

“Our teams evacuated several displaced families after their tents were also flooded,” the Civil Defence said, describing scenes of people wading through mud with what little they still own.

The agency said its responders “provided assistance to a number of displaced families whose tents were flooded in the vicinity of Bir 22 and helped them resecure the damaged tent pegs”, after severe weather tore through the area.

Winter has now settled over a devastated enclave where tens of thousands live under plastic sheets because Israeli attacks have wiped out entire neighbourhoods.

Cold winds and driving rain have turned crowded campgrounds into sodden, unsafe spaces, piling fresh hardship on families already pushed to the brink by Israel’s genocide.

title: Football fans in Bilbao march in support as Palestine plays first European match
summary:
Football fans in Bilbao march in support as Palestine plays first European match

Thousands marched in support of Palestine in the Spanish city of Bilbao as Palestinian footballers played their first European match against the Basque Country team.

The Basque Country team beat the Palestine team 3-0 in the friendly match, which was marked by shows of solidarity between both teams.

Palestinians and the Basque have long shared political sympathies, with both involved in nationalist struggles for independence.

The two teams celebrated side by side, arms around each other, on the San Mames pitch in front of more than 50,000 spectators.

"It's difficult to coach when your mother lives in a makeshift tent. I come from Gaza," Palestinian coach Ehab Abu Jazar told AFP.

"We lost nearly 200 people in my family. My house was destroyed - but representing Palestine is the greatest honour there is."

Read more: Football fans in Bilbao march in support as Palestine plays first European match

title: Israeli forces shoot dead man in Gaza City
summary:
Israeli forces shoot dead man in Gaza City

Israeli forces have shot dead a Palestinian man after they opened fire on civilians in Gaza City's Tuffah neighbourhood, Al Jazeera is reporting, citing a source at al-Ahli hospital.

According to the report, the attack occurred behind the so-called "Yellow Line".

We reported earlier that three other Palestinians were killed in Israeli air strikes in Gaza City and Khan Younis.

title: Football fans in Bilbao march in support as Palestine plays first European match
summary:
Football fans in Bilbao march in support as Palestine plays first European match

Submitted by Alex MacDonald on Sun, 11/16/2025 - 13:53
Fans and campaigners highlight Basque-Palestinian ties as Basque Country teams win 3-0 in friendly match
People take part in a demonstration with the slogan “Basque Country, Palestine. Free countries! Stop genocide!” ahead of the friendly football match between Basque Country and Palestine at San Mames Stadium in Bilbao on 15 November 2025 (Ander Gillenea/AFP)
Off

Thousands marched in support of Palestine in the Spanish city of Bilbao as Palestinian footballers played their first European match against the Basque Country team.

The Basque Country team beat the Palestine team 3-0 in the friendly match, which was marked by shows of solidarity between both teams.

Palestinians and the Basque have long shared political sympathies, with both involved in nationalist struggles for independence.

The two teams celebrated side by side, arms around each other, on the San Mames pitch in front of more than 50,000 spectators.

"It's difficult to coach when your mother lives in a makeshift tent. I come from Gaza," Palestinian coach Ehab Abu Jazar told AFP.

"We lost nearly 200 people in my family. My house was destroyed - but representing Palestine is the greatest honour there is."

The match raised funds for Doctors Without Borders (MSF), which is among the organisations supporting Palestinians in the devastated enclave, where more than 71,000 people have been killed and millions displaced.

Supporters also unveiled images of Suleiman al-Obeid, the former captain of Palestine’s national team, who was killed by Israel in Gaza.

According to the Palestine Football Association, 1,100 Palestinian athletes, employees, coaches and referees have been killed since the beginning of the war.

Prior to the match, thousands of demonstrators marched through the streets in support of Gaza, highlighting historic ties of solidarity between Basque and Palestinian nationalism.

The Palestinian team is set to play against the Catalan team next week, another region of Spain that has historically sought independence from the country.

The Spanish government has been one of the most overtly critical governments in Europe with regard to Israel since the beginning of the war in October 2023.

In May 2024, Spain - along with Ireland and Norway -recognised Palestine as a state, while Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez has publicly described Israel's assault on Gaza as a genocide.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Israeli army cites 'poor weather conditions' as reason for firing at UN peacekeepers
summary:
Israeli army cites 'poor weather conditions' as reason for firing at UN peacekeepers

The Israeli army said that its soldiers fired at UN Interim Force in Lebanon (Unifil) peacekeepers from a tank in southern Lebanon due to "poor weather conditions", which meant they mistook the observers for "suspects".

Unifil said that Israeli soldiers fired at its observers "from a Merkava tank from near a position Israel has established in Lebanese territory”.

The military said in a statement that “two suspects were identified in the Hammis area in southern Lebanon”, “the forces fired shots to disperse them and the suspects fled, without any casualties”.

“After an investigation, it emerged that the suspects were UN soldiers who were patrolling the area and were classified as suspects due to poor weather conditions. The incident is being investigated," it added.

title: UN peacekeepers say they were fired at by Israeli soldiers in southern Lebanon
summary:
UN peacekeepers say they were fired at by Israeli soldiers in southern Lebanon

The UN Interim Force in Lebanon (Unifil) has said that the Israeli military fired at its observers "from a Merkava tank from near a position Israel has established in Lebanese territory”.

In a statement, Unifil reported that machine gun fire “hit approximately 5m from the peacekeepers, who were on foot and had to take shelter in the terrain”.

“Peacekeepers asked for the [Israeli forces] to stop firing through Unifil's liaison channels. They were able to leave safely 30 minutes later, when the Merkava tank withdrew inside the [Israeli military] position."

Unifil said the shooting "represents a serious violation of UN Security Council Resolution 1701", which formed the basis of last November's truce between Israel and Hezbollah.

The Israeli military has yet to comment on the attack.

This is not the first time the peacekeeping force has been targeted by Israeli fire. In September, Unifil reported that Israeli drones dropped four grenades, which landed within 20m of its personnel.

title: Gaza hospitals receive 17 bodies in last 24 hours
summary:
Gaza hospitals receive 17 bodies in last 24 hours

Gaza's hospitals have received the bodies of 17 Palestinians in the last 72 hours, Wafa news agency is reporting, citing medical sources.

It reported that two people had been killed in Israeli attacks, while rescue teams recovered 15 bodies from the rubble.

This brings the overall number of Palestinians killed by Israeli forces in Gaza since October 2023 to 69,483.

Since the fragile ceasefire was implemented on 11 October 2025, 266 people have been killed in Israeli attacks, 635 wounded and 548 bodies recovered from the rubble.

title: Lebanon to complain to UN over Israel wall-building in south
summary:
Lebanon to complain to UN over Israel wall-building in south

Lebanon's government is set to complain to the UN over allegations that Israel is building a wall in occupied territory in the south.

On Friday, the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (Unifil) said the Israeli army had built walls in south Lebanon near the UN-demarcated Blue Line.

Israel has denied the allegations, but on Sunday, President Joseph Aoun's office said he had instructed officials "to file an urgent complaint to the United Nations Security Council against Israel for constructing a concrete wall on Lebanon's southern border exceeding the Blue Line".

Unifil said last month that its peacekeepers had surveyed a concrete T-wall erected by the Israeli army southwest of Yaroun and found that it "crossed the Blue Line, rendering more than 4,000 square metres of Lebanese territory inaccessible to the Lebanese people".

An Israeli military spokesperson told AFP that since the start of the war in Gaza, the Israeli army "has implemented a series of measures, including strengthening the physical barrier along the northern border".

Read more: Lebanon to complain to UN over Israel wall-building in south

title: Israeli settlers storm Palestinian towns near Ramallah
summary:
Israeli settlers storm Palestinian towns near Ramallah

Israeli settlers have stormed the village of al-Mughayyir, north east of Ramallah in the occupied West Bank,  Wafa news agency is reporting, citing local sources.

The sources said that the settlers, under military escort, had raided agricultural land belonging to the community, which lies about 27km from Ramallah.

In a separate incident, Wafa reported that Israeli settlers stormed the town of Sinjil, damaging vehicles belonging to Palestinian residents.

title: Lebanon to complain to UN over Israel wall-building in south
summary:
Lebanon to complain to UN over Israel wall-building in south

Submitted by MEE staff on Sun, 11/16/2025 - 11:15
Unifil says more than 4,000 sqm of Lebanese territory have been made 'inaccessible to the Lebanese people'
Troops from the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (Unifil) patrol near the southern Lebanese border village of Kfar Kila on 12 November 2025 (Rabih Daher/AFP)
Off

Lebanon's government is set to complain to the UN over allegations that Israel is building a wall in occupied territory in the south.

On Friday, the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (Unifil) said the Israeli army had built walls in south Lebanon near the UN-demarcated Blue Line.

Israel has denied the allegations, but on Sunday, President Joseph Aoun's office said he had instructed officials "to file an urgent complaint to the United Nations Security Council against Israel for constructing a concrete wall on Lebanon's southern border exceeding the Blue Line".

Unifil said last month that its peacekeepers had surveyed a concrete T-wall erected by the Israeli army southwest of Yaroun and found that it "crossed the Blue Line, rendering more than 4,000 square metres of Lebanese territory inaccessible to the Lebanese people".

An Israeli military spokesperson told AFP that since the start of the war in Gaza, the Israeli army "has implemented a series of measures, including strengthening the physical barrier along the northern border".

"The wall does not cross the Blue Line," he asserted, stating that its construction began in 2022.

Nearly a year on from the ceasefire that ended the war between Israel and Hezbollah, Israeli forces have continued near-daily bombardments across the south and the occupation of at least five areas.

More than 300 people, including over 100 civilians, have been killed in Israeli strikes since 27 November 2024.

Israel's war on Lebanon

title: South African activists allege Israel used shadowy NGO to 'traffic' Palestinians from Gaza
summary:
South African activists allege Israel used shadowy NGO to 'traffic' Palestinians from Gaza

South African activists have alleged that Israel is using a shadowy humanitarian group to force Palestinians out of Gaza, in what they decried as the latest form of ethnic cleansing to take place since October 2023.

On Thursday, a plane carrying 153 Palestinians from Gaza landed at South Africa's O.R. Tambo International Airport, but the plane was held on the tarmac for around 12 hours with passengers not allowed to disembark - triggering confusion and anger against local authorities.

Within hours, however, activists and South African authorities discovered several irregularities in the way the Palestinians' travel had been organised by a body called Al-Majd Europe.

Activists found that not only had the South African government been unaware of their arrival, but the evacuees themselves were not in possession of any documentation or paperwork to assist with their processing in the country.

The activists said that what was even more shocking, was that several Palestinians said they had embarked on the trip without fully knowing where they were going.

Read more: South African activists allege Israel used shadowy NGO to 'traffic' Palestinians from Gaza

title: WHO: 900 patients in Gaza died while waiting for medical evacuations
summary:
WHO: 900 patients in Gaza died while waiting for medical evacuations

The World Health Organization has reported that over 900 patients in Gaza have died while waiting for medical evacuations, which have been stalled by Israeli restrictions.

According to the agency, around 16,000 patients in the enclave are awaiting approval for evacuation, including some 4,000 children who are in urgent need of the life-saving transfers.

It warned that any further delay in handling these cases is tantamount to a death sentence.

It further noted that hospitals across Gaza are operating at less than half their capacity as they continue to grapple with shortages of fuel, medicine and medical equipment amid tight Israeli restrictions on the entry of these vital supplies into the territory.

WHO has conducted 119 medical evacuations of patients from the strip since May 2024, transferring 8,000 patients, including 5,500 children.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian says that the Armed Forces’ capacities and capabilities can greatly assist the administration and the country as a whole in addressing issues and correcting imbalances.

title: AEOI chief says proposal for new anti-Iran resolution is repetitive
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Head of the Atomic Energy Organization of Iran (AEOI) Mohammad Eslami said the European Troika’s efforts to pass a new resolution against Iran at the upcoming International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Board of Governors meeting is repetitive and aims to exert more pressure on Iran.

title: Iran to respond to potential IAEA resolution with foreign policy re-evaluation: Deputy FM
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabadi has indicated that Iran will undertake a significant reevaluation of its foreign policy if the European trio (Britain, France, and Germany) tries to pass a new resolution against the Islamic Republic at the IAEA Board of Governors.

title: US-Israeli attacks on Iran’s nuclear sites ‘unprecedented’ as they targeted IAEA-inspected facilities: Top nuclear official
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Mohammad Eslami, vice-president and head of the Atomic Energy Organization of Iran, says the recent US-Israeli airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities were unprecedented in history, as the attacks targeted sites under intensive inspection by the UN nuclear watchdog, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).

title: US not prepared for results-oriented negotiation: Senior diplomat
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister Saeed Khatibzadeh has censured the United States for lacking readiness for any “real, results-oriented negotiation,” saying Washington relies on pressure, threats and theatrical diplomacy rather than genuine dialogue.

title: Zarif: Peace and stability pose ‘biggest threat’ to Israel
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Former foreign minister Mohammad-Javad Zarif says peace and stability pose the “biggest and only threat” to Israel, arguing that the occupying regime has consistently opposed any prospect of regional calm, including the 2015 nuclear agreement.

title: Diplomacy remains viable solution via adherence to principles: Iran’s FM
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has emphasized the enduring importance of diplomacy in resolving conflicts, noting that despite recent military aggression against Iran, which is considered an assault on diplomatic efforts, there remains no alternative to negotiation.

title: Aoun orders UN complaint over Israeli wall construction
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – Lebanon will file a complaint to the United Nations Security Council decrying that Israel is building walls in south Lebanon, the Lebanese presidency said.

title: “Book, Book Reading, Librarian” Day in Tehran
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – The commemoration ceremony of the Day of “Book, Book Reading and Librarian” was held at Tehran’s Vahdat Hall on Sunday in the presence of President Pezeshkian and Culture Minister Abbas Salehi.

title: “Book, Book Reading, Librarian” Day observed in Tehran
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – The commemoration ceremony of the Day of “Book, Book Reading and Librarian” was held at Shahid Modaress Hall of the Judiciary Branch in Tehran with the participation of Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf.

title: Egyptian, Russian FMs confer on Iran nuclear issue
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – The foreign ministers of Egypt and Russia discussed Iran's nuclear program in a telephone call on Sunday.

title: Iran’s men’s handball downs Maldives: 2025 ISG
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – The national men’s handball team of Iran defeated Maldives 57-14 at the 2025 Islamic Solidarity Games (ISG) on Sunday.

title: Iran best transit route for landlocked countries: VP Aref
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – Iran’s First Vice President Mohammadreza Aref says that Iran is the best transit rote for the landlocked countries.

title: Meeting between Putin, Trump postponed: Kremlin
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – The Russia-US summit in Budapest has been postponed, Kremlin aide Yury Ushakov said.

title: Ghalibaf receives Lebanese Parl. speaker's political deputy
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – Iranian Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf has received for a meeting the deputy speaker of the Lebanese Parliament.

title: European troika wants to make up for their failure in Vienna
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – Iran’s Deputy Foreign Minister for the Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabadi says European troika-including UK, France and Germany- failed over Iran nuclear program and wants to compensate their failure in Vienna.

title: Iran defeats Malaysia at IFCPF Asia-Oceania Cup 2025
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – Iran trounced Malaysia 6-1 in its opening match of the IFCPF Asia-Oceania Cup 2025 on Sunday.

title: Press conference of Iran Geo Exhibition in Tehran
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – The press conference for the 5th International “Iran Geo” Exhibition and the 29th National Geomatics Conference and Exhibition 2025 was held on Saturday evening.

title: Pezeshkian enacts Iran-Turkey railway coop. agreement
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 16 (MNA) – President Masoud Pezeshkian has signed into law the Agreement on Railway Cooperation between Iran’s Ministry of Roads and Urban Development and Turkey’s Ministry of Transport and Infrastructure.

title: جلیلی: ملت ایران در برابر توطئه‌های دشمن خم به ابرو نمی‌آورد
summary: دامغان- عضو مجمع تشخیص مصلحت با تأکید بر مقاومت ملت ایران در برابر توطئه‌های دشمنان، گفت: بیش از دو سال است دشمن در غزه دست به قتل‌عام زده اما نتوانسته به اهدافش دست یابد.

title: رحیمی آذر: روغن فروشان متخلف در اردبیل بهای سنگینی پرداخت کردند
summary: اردبیل-مدیرکل تعزیرات حکومتی اردبیل گفت: ۴۸ متخلف توزیع و فروش روغن خوراکی در هفت ماه اول سال جاری، ۴۰۰ میلیارد ریال جریمه شدند.

title: بیداردل : مرزداران در دفاع از مرزهای کشور صاحب شکوه هستند
summary: بوشهر- دادستان نظامی سازمان قضائی نیروهای مسلح استان بوشهر گفت: مرزداران غیرتمند ما همواره در دفاع از مرزهای این کشور صاحب شکوه، عظمت و غیرت ماندگار بوده اند.

title: تبریز میزبان پیکرهای مطهر شهدای گمنام
summary: تبریز- رئیس شورای هماهنگی تبلیغات اسلامی آذربایجان شرقی گفت:مراسم استقبال از پیکرهای مطهر شهدای گمنام استان روز ۲۷ آبان‌ماه در تبریز برگزار خواهد شد.

title: سارا شفیعی در رقابتهای ووشو قهرمان شد/ دوازدهمین طلا برای کاروان ایران
summary: ملی پوش ووشو ایران با پیروزی در مبارزه فینال موفق شد به مدال طلای این رشته در ششمین دوره بازیهای کشورهای اسلامی دست یافت.

title: فرماندار تنگستان: لایروبی سازه‌های آبخیزداری ضروری است
summary: بوشهر- فرماندار تنگستان بر لایروبی سازه‌های آبخیزداری در تقویت آب‌های زیرزمینی و احیای چاه‌های کشاورزی در منطقه محمود احمدی تنگستان تاکید کرد.
